    • Method Detail

      • run

        public abstract boolean run(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                            java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes the command.
        Parameters:
        sender - The one who sent the command
        args - An array of relevant arguments stripped of prior command path arguments
        Returns:
        True if the command suceeded. If returned false, a ErrorType.Fail will be passed back through the class.

      • handleError

        public abstract void handleError(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                 ErrorType type)
        Handles the error caused, generally sends a message back to the sender. This is meant to be handled on the client's end.
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of the command that caused an error.
        type - The type of error that was caused.

      • getUsage

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUsage()
        Gets a list of Strings that explains the usage of the command
        Returns:
        A list of strings that detail the command's usage.

      • getPermission

        public final java.lang.String getPermission()
        The permission required by a player to use this command.
        Returns:
        The permission a player requires for this command.

      • hasPermission

        public final boolean hasPermission(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Checks if the commandsender is a player. If they are, it then checks to see if they have permission.
        Parameters:
        sender - The sender of the command.
        Returns:
        boolean if they do not have permission.

      • getCommandPath

        public final java.lang.String getCommandPath()
        Returns the command path
        Returns:
        the command path. Command paths are delimited by '.'
